VVLayer Class Reference

class VVLayer is formed from a collection of neurons. Many layers form a network. The class contains a pointer for pointing to an array of neurons. It contains all the details which makes the layer complete. More...

Detailed Description

class VVLayer is formed from a collection of neurons. Many layers form a network. The class contains a pointer for pointing to an array of neurons. It contains all the details which makes the layer complete.

Member Function Documentation

double VVLayer::vvbiased (  int  index  )  [inline]
 

Gets biasing weight of a neuron.

This function gets the <index>th neuron's biasing weight of the current layer, and returns it as a double.

double VVLayer::vvget_perceptron (  int  index  )  [inline]
 

Gets state of a neuron.

This function gets the <index>th neuron's state of the current layer, and returns it as a double.

double VVLayer::vvget_perceptron_accumulator (  int  index  )  [inline]
 

Gets accumulated input of a neuron.

This function gets the <index>th neuron's accumulated input of the current layer, and returns it as a double.

void VVLayer::vvlayer_bias_perceprton (  int  index,
double  val
)  [inline]
 

Sets biasing weight for a neuron.

This function sets the <index>th neuron's biasing weight with the value <val> in the current layer.

long int VVLayer::vvlayer_number_neuron (   )  [inline]
 

Returns number of Neurons.

This function returns the number of neurons present in the layer as long int.

void VVLayer::vvlayerinit (  long int  a  )  [inline]
 

Due to the particular implementation of this class, vvlayerinit acts as a constructor which can be called.

This function creates the neurons dynamicaly. It should not be called explicitly by the programmer unless he is creating a custom network or knows what he is doing.

void VVLayer::vvlayeruninit (   )  [inline]
 

Due to the particular implementation of this class, vvlayeruninit acts as a destructor which can be called.

This function removes the neurons and deletes the pointer. It should not be called explicitly by the programmer unless he is creating a custom network or knows what he is doing.

void VVLayer::vvset_perceptron (  int  index,
double  val
)  [inline]
 

Sets the state for a neuron.

This function sets the <index>th neuron's state with the value <val> in the current layer.

void VVLayer::vvset_perceptron_accumulator (  int  index,
double  S
)  [inline]
 

Sets accumulated input of a neuron.

This function sets the <index>th neuron's accumulated input(input just before it passes into the transfer functions to obtain the state) to the value <S>, of the current layer.

Member Data Documentation

VVNeuron* VVLayer::perceptrons [protected]
 

This is the pointer, to an array of neurons required in the layer

long int VVLayer::vvneuronnumbers [protected]
 

vvneuronnumbers is a variable that contains how many neurons are present in the layer.
